    • Method Detail

      • realNonZeroOnly

        public static double[] realNonZeroOnly(Complex[] r)

      • solveUsingDepressedCubic0

        static Complex[] solveUsingDepressedCubic0(double p0,
                                           double q0)
        solve for t given coefficients p and q using the depressed cubic root t^3 + p*t + q = 0. The given coefficients are transformed internally to those used by Pearson in "Handbook of Applied Mathematics" which uses t^3 + (3q_p)*t + (2r_p) = 0.
        Parameters:
        p0 - coefficient p for the first order term.
        q0 - coefficient q for the zero order term.
        Returns:
        returns the roots of the polynomial w/ the given depressed cubic parameters. NOTE that if an empty array is returned, one can use solveUsingGeneral

      • solveUsingDepressedCubic

        public static double[] solveUsingDepressedCubic(double p,
                                                double q)
        solve for t given coefficients p and q using the depressed cubic root t^3 + p*t + q = 0. following https://www.mathemania.com/lesson/cardanos-formula-solving-cubic-equations/ https://www.wikiwand.com/en/Cubic_equation#/google_vignette https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cubic_equation#Reduction_to_a_depressed_cubic NOTE: only solving for the real, rational roots.
        Parameters:
        p - coefficient p for the first order term.
        q - coefficient q for the zero order term.
        Returns:
        returns the roots of the polynomial w/ the given depressed cubic parameters. NOTE that if an empty array is returned, one can use solveUsingGeneral

      • calcDepressedCubicCoefficients

        static double[] calcDepressedCubicCoefficients(double[] cubicCoeff)
        calculates coefficients for the reduced form of the cubic equation called the depressed cubic.
        Parameters:
        cubicCoeff -
        Returns:
        a, b, c, p, q. returns null if cubicCoeff[0] = 0.

      • solve

        public static double[] solve(double[] coeffs)
                      throws no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
        solve for the roots of the equation a*x^3 + b*x^2 + c*x + d = 0 using the depressed cubic. the method is given coefficients a, b, c, d. and then returns x. following https://www.mathemania.com/lesson/cardanos-formula-solving-cubic-equations/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cubic_equation#Reduction_to_a_depressed_cubic NOTE: only solving for the real roots.
        Parameters:
        coeffs - an array holding a, b, c , d for the equation a*x^3 + b*x^2 + c*x + d = 0.
        Returns:
        x as the roots of the cubic equation a*x^3 + b*x^2 + c*x + d = 0
        Throws:
        no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException

      • solveUsingGeneral

        public static double[] solveUsingGeneral(double[] coeffs)
                                  throws no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
        solve for the roots of the equation a*x^3 + b*x^2 + c*x + d = 0 using the general formula, given coefficients a, b, c, d. returns x. following https://www.wikiwand.com/en/Cubic_equation#/General_cubic_formula
        Parameters:
        coeffs - an array holding a, b, c , d for the equation a*x^3 + b*x^2 + c*x + d = 0.
        Returns:
        x as the roots of the cubic equation a*x^3 + b*x^2 + c*x + d = 0
        Throws:
        no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
